text: Hampton railway station is located on the Sandringham line in Victoria, Australia. It serves the south-eastern Melbourne suburb of Hampton, and it opened on 2 September 1887. It was renamed Retreat on 1 October 1887, and was renamed back to Hampton on 10 September 1889.Hampton Vicsig Boom barriers replaced interlocked gates at the Hampton Street level crossing, located at the south (Down) end of the station, in 1966. The signal box was also abolished during this time. The station buildings were reconstructed in 1975. In November 2016, a proposed development near Hampton station generated controversy, as it was seen as "bringing a white cruise ship" to Hampton. ==Platforms and services== Hampton has two side platforms. It is serviced by Metro Trains' Sandringham line services. On rare occasions, extra services for major events may originate at Hampton instead of Sandringham. These services are formed by empty trains directly from the stabling yard at Sandringham. title: Hampton railway station, Melbourne
